English.Text: "Developing a spaceport will be a great deal of work. Let's call in the professionals."

The year is 2205. Humanity must rely on energy-intensive technology to meet the challenges posed by environmentally changed home planet. A global energy crisis becomes more and more iminent. The newly developed fusion reactors carry a promise of hope, but require resources only found on the Moons. And so, the world government of the Global Union started the Lunar Licencing Program, allowing corporations to support the government-owned lunar mining colonies with private ones.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] asks you to provide housing for your construction crew.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] recommends you to be wary of the competition.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] reports the arrival of the construction crew.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] appreciates that you provide organic food for your population.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is glad your biopolymer production is up and running.
Build [CONDITION_PROFILE_COUNTER_CONTEXT_OBJECT] and connect it to the [GUIDNAME 1000157]
"Your spaceport is furnished with high-end equipment. Proficient operating personnel is a necessity."

The First Wave of Lunar Colonization lies one hundred years in the past. Today lunar mining is overseen by the government-owned Lunar Excavation Corp. Bloated and ineffective, the L.E.C. lost the Global Union's favor long ago and was largely left on their own. Still, it took decades of lobbyism on part of the Big Five to make the Global Union start a new lunar colonization program. Prevailing against these five gargantuan corporations dominating the world market, will require you to invest only the best spaceport technology. And qualified personnel to operate it.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] points out your space program's demand for skilled ground personnel.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is convinced your corporation has risen to bigger challenges.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] welcomes your efforts to secure the water supply.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] speaks in high terms of your newly built Infodrome.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] and her peers boot up the spaceport's control systems.
"A long way to go. Your space elevator will lead directly to the Global Union's orbital headquarters."

The unforeseen Orbital Watch shook the world to its core. One by one the colonies of the Lunar Excavation Corporporation side with the terrorists and suspend their resource deliveries to Earth. The Moon dwellers, who refuse to follow Virgil Drake's crude rethoric live in danger of oppression. Those who can board shuttles to Earth, but many more don't have this opportunity. Drake's demand to forfeit the Lunar Licencing Program puts the Global Union in a tight spot. But for the sake of all humanity, the program has to go on. And so has the construction of your space elevator.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] wants you to build a space elevator to the Global Union space station.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] announces the coming of additional material deliveries.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] tells you additional materials will be delivered, specifically for the elevator cable.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] knows a good employer keeps his staff satisfied - like you do.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] calls on you to proceed with the elevator construction, once everything else is ready.
Start the upgrade
"The whole sector was closed off. It seems military intervention is our only option."

Before the Lunar Licencing Program, the mining of Moon resources was the exclusive domain of the Lunar Excavation Corp. But as the Global Union turned its focus away from this organization, the Moon people began to feel neglected and exploited – fertile ground for the ideology of the Orbital Watch, a well-connected terrorist organisation of former L.E.C. members. And now, their warships draw a tight circle around the Prycomber strait, blocking the Global Union’s most important trade route to sabotage the Lunar Licencing program. Security engineer John Rafferty is determined not to let this happen.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] urges you to meet John Rafferty at Prycoast Search Area and retrieve the static cable.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is relieved to see you back in one piece.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] keeps a stiff upper lip.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] spotted the location of the beleagured Union cargo ship.
Enter the crisis sector
Free the detained transporters
"Let those lunar terrorists continue their intimidation attempts. The space program is far too important for Earth's people."
Worried of the situation on the Moon, [NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] urges you to finish the space elevator.

The unforeseen Orbital Watch shook the world to its core. One by one the colonies of the Lunar Excavation Corporporation side with the terrorists and suspend their resource deliveries to Earth. The Moon dwellers, who refuse to follow Virgil Drake's crude rethoric live in danger of oppression. Those who can board shuttles to Earth, but many more don't have this opportunity. Drake's demand to forfeit the Lunar Licencing Program puts the Global Union in a tight spot, but for the sake of all humanity, it has to go on.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] wants you to return to the spaceport site.
Finalize the upgrade
"The Arctic holds resources found nowhere else. You should consider a branch there."

The second phase of the Lunar Licensing Program has begun. It points right to the North Pole, the snow-clad hoard of the Earth's last treasures. Protecting the few remaining sources of crude oil and the only ecosystem still bringing forth fish in harvestable quantities, the environmentalist organization called the Arctic Custodians held a stern watch here for almost two centuries. But as things are, the Custodians must share their white paradise with private corporations. They are not happy about this.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] announces the next phase of the Lunar Licensing Program.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] had hoped for a friendlier reception.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] can't wait to assign you arctic territory.
"All formalities have been taken care of. These islands have been approved for settlement by the Arctic Custodians."

Like white diamonds, the icy isles of the Arctic rise up from the sea. Cold, hard and uninviting, they form the territory of the Arctic Custodians. It was them, who developed the climate stabilization technology, enabling them to create a genuine Arctic region in a world battered by the polar melting of the late 21st century. Steadying the global weather, the climate stabilizers exposed settlement areas formerly lost to the sea – at the cost of vast amounts of energy. The Custodians have made clear, they don't want you to interfere with their delicate technology, while you are establishing your first arctic branch office.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] wants you to erect an Arctic Warehouse on one of these islands.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] officially confirms your tenures for this settlement zone.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] encourages you to choose an island of your liking.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] will assign you an island, once you build an Arctic Warehouse there.
Move your Command Ship to a [CONDITION_SOURCE_OBJECT_ASSET]
Claim the island
"You'll see, the Arctic landscape will impose very different requirements on your city planning skills.”

Over the course of their work the Arctic Custodians have seen many governments eager to decide the fate of the world. Consequently, many off-hours conferences at the Union headquarter were necessary, until the Arctic Custodians destisted from their prejudices and agreed on opening their secluded territories for the Lunar Licencing Program. Still, Dr. Howard Young, onsite representative of the Custodians, will not tolerate carelessness – and much less if it comes to the standards to be met by private industries on Arctic territory.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] suggests you establish a small Arctic base.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] gives permission for spaceport construction.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] has an eye on both economic and ecological developments.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] informs you just how rare fish has become.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] points at the importance of good heat insulation.
Settle your employees close to a heat source
"The Global Union trade routes are still threatend by terrorists. You better establish your own landing place for cargo ships."

Before the opening of the polar regions, Arctic trade was confined to official Arctic Custodian routes, not allowing for much commercial variety on both sides of the trade treaties. With the Global Union routes under constant siege by the Orbital Watch however, the Arctic seaways are increasingly being called for. And while mighty icebreakers set forth to crack safe, new ways through the brash ice, the Global Union plans to link the Arctic economy closer to the world market – via landing places for cargo ships and a space elevator.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] recommends the expansion of your Arctic spaceport via a pier.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] asks you for help.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] deems the head count of employees enough to proceed.
"If they aim at it, they can use the Climate Stabilizers to cause a second climate catastrophe! We must act!"

In 2085, in the aftermath of the disastrous prototyping of geothermal power plants in the Ebashi Trench, global weather drifted to the extremes. Subsequently, the researchers of the environmentalist group called the Eden Initiative founded the Arctic Custodians and developed climate stabilization technology, creating an artificial Arctic zone. And now, 120 years later, Earth faces a new climate catastrophe: The terrorist Orbital Watch assumed control of the Climate Stabilizers. They want to watch the world burn.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] pushes you to help the Arctic Custodians reclaim control of the Climate Stabilizers.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is glad to tell you the main Climate Stabilizers have been recovered.
Achieve victory in the crisis sector "[GUIDNAME 5100031]"

Standard.Name: Reach the Next Corporation Level (Objective Text)
Standard.Creator: claurer

English.Text: Reach the next corporation level to enact a counter-hacking attempt
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is curious about the outcome.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] informs you that your help was received.
"The work at the piers is almost done. Make sure to finish them so your Arctic cargo ships can head for sunnier climates."

The Arctic climate might be returning to colder temperatures again, but the frigid relations between the Global Union and the Arctic Custodians are slowly thawing. The Orbital Watch has proven that it is game for anything and commands the firepower to back their demands up. Only cooperation and determination prevented Earth from slipping into a new climatic disaster. The Arctic Custodians are willing to support the Lunar Licencing Program fully now, green-lighting the expansion of your spaceport.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] requests you to take your Arctic shipping docks into operation.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] deems your pursuit for the Moon even more important than before.
"Your aerospace technology has to adhere to the Program's standards. Make sure to have enough shrewd heads at the task."

The Lunar Licencing Program applies high standards to the space technology deployed in it. While past colonizations of the Moon have been successful, relying on old machinery to propel the Second Wave would not be met with the Union's approval – the program is a fresh start into space and any resemblances with the ancient tech of the L.E.C. are to be avoided by its partners. Even if that means great research efforts.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] requests you to establish a research team.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] greenlights the implementation of the shuttle blueprints.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is full of praise for your neuro implant production.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] approves of your vitamin drink supply.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] knows that a strong community is important these days.

Conceiving new ways of space travel formerly thought impossible, your aerospace engineers have developed more than ambitious blueprints for shuttles and launch pads. As a proof of their newly found confidence in the Lunar Licencing Program, the Arctic Custodians loosened the export restrictions for greater amounts of mineral resources. Time will tell, if the Big Five jump at this opportunity.
"The metals mined in the Arctic region are perfectly suited for space technology."
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] states that you need specific steels to construct the colony shuttles from.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] approves of the superalloys.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is sure these alloys will come in use outside shuttle construction, too.
"Be assured, the command personnel of the Program will have more sophisticated needs than your common worker."

Through bold, persitent lobbyism the Big Five achieved privileged participation rights for the Lunar Licencing Program before it even started. Yet Orbital Affairs Secretary Samantha Beaumont mobilized the forces of her party to bring you into the program as well, an underdog, acting as a counterpoise to the long-established MegaCorps. Her plan proves to be successful so far: Your corporation is growing relentlessly. But even the most well-organized CEO can’t take care of everything at once.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] wants you to shift responsibilities to executives.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is looking forward to Phase 2 being completed.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] underlines how important neuro tech is for the program.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] sees much potential in your medical products.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] relies on minute security controls when dealing with terrorism.
"No launch pad, no rocket launch. An ambitious building project lies ahead of you."

The Global Union's Ministry of Orbital Affairs, responsible for overseeing the lunar territories and orbital routes, has only been a small department of the Global Union governing body – and a less than prestigious at that, if one looks at the hapless L.E.C. it was in charge of. The Lunar Licencing Program changed that. Now the Ministry of Orbital Affairs connects the world and you are preparing for the big leap to the Moon. To provide for the necessary momentum, launching pad be installed at your spaceport. To coordinate the construction teams, you have to consolidate your corporation's management level.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] asks you to support John Rafferty with the launch pad construction.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is starting with the launch pad construction.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is happy to see all processes are tightly organized.
"The launch pad construction is well underway. Please arrange for the necessary rare materials."

Steel beam per steel beam, the shuttle launching pads are growing towards the sky, the work of countless busy hands. Lunar Licencing Program supervisor Samantha Beaumont brought in the old gearhead John Rafferty to coordinate the efforts. His presence in the Lunar Licencing Program has led to controversies in the Ministry of Orbital Affairs, especially among the sympathizers of the Big Five. On the quiet, words like "infringement" and "prison term" are voiced, but Rafferty doesn't seem to mind. He much rather sees after the completion launch pad for the Second Wave.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] gives a forecast of what has to be done next.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is proud to present a finished shuttle launching pad.
Achieve victory in a crisis sector
Complete optional assignments
"The big moment has arrived. So many people, all burning to see those shuttles fly..."

The colony shuttles are ready for take-off, crewed with brave women and men, leaving behind their easy, earthly life for the unfathomable universe. Last-minute tests are conducted, while the rocket propellant tanks are attached to the bottom of the shuttles. All over the globe, people lay down their tools and set eyes on the big and small screens broadcasting this happening. With bated breath, they are awaiting the countdown of the Second Wave of lunar colonisation.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] can hardly wait for the colony shuttles to lift off.
Following the rocket with her gaze, [NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] announces the start of Phase 3.
"Your colony shuttles are heading for the lunar orbit. They're awaiting orders where to touch down."

The pioneers of the Second Wave set forth for the Moon's grey, alien landscape. It is a voyage into the unknown. Frontier spirit and sense of adventure, that made the colonists leave the familiar atmosphere of Earth behind, blends with anxiety about the terroristic Orbital Watch. It had been some time since the Global Union space station last received news from the L.E.C. And Virgil Drakes will not take a new colony on the Moon lightly.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is eager to present you lunar settlement zones to choose from.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] signs over a high quality plot of lunar land.
"A good spot for a lunar colony, if you ask me. And it's all yours."

Hills and valleys covered in dead, gray dust are stretching to the black, starlit horizon. But even in an environment as hostile as the Moon, humanity has a chance to thrive, as hundred years of continued lunar settlement show. In the L.E.C. colonies, whole generations of people have lived and died. Your colonists may not be the first to leave their footprint on the Moon. But they are here. And maybe they can set things right, once they are given a basic supply framework and a place to call home.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] informs you that moon colonies may only be established in craters.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] thinks you are ready for the next step.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is threatening you openly.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is willing to start work right away.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] stresses the critical importance of good oxygen supply.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] explains what materials are needed to build space structures.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] shows you how vulnerable your colony would be without shield generators.
"Solid interorbital trade routes are the key, if you want your corporation to replace the L.E.C. as lunar resource supplier.”

The Lunar Excavation Corp. did not always possess exclusive rights to mine and distribute lunar resources. Before their foundation by the Global Union, private corporations have conducted an armed war over the territories and resources Earth's satellite had to offer. The event entered the history ebooks as the "Eclipse". After a long peace, the Orbital Watch is more than willing to turn the Moon into a battlefield again. Breasting them will not be possible without steady support from Earth and direct orbital transportation routes.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] informs you about the logistical demands your spaceport will have to meet.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] lets you in on what has been done for the L.E.C. fugitives coming to Earth so far.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is impressed by how many people are flocking to your Moon colony.
"Neither the L.E.C. fugitives, nor their Arctic Custodians guardians have the means to brave Drake. You however..."

In the aftermath of the Orbital Watch’s advent to power, moon dwellers opposing the movement’s radical ideology faced oppression and persecution. Those who could secretly fled to Earth with cargo shuttles. The Global Union, overwhelmed by the sheer number of fugitives, used their newly-established diplomatic relations with the Arctic Custodians to set up a provisional reception camp in the Arctic. But the Orbital Watch is without mercy if it comes to dealing with "traitors" ...
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] appeals to you to help the L.E.C. fugitives.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] thanks you profoundly.
Achieve victory in the crisis sector "[GUIDNAME 5100395]"
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] speculates that Virgil Drake maintains his own military facilities on Earth.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] informs you your economical support enabled the Arctic Custodians to help the fugitives.

Standard.Name: Reach the Next Corporation Level (Objective Text)
Standard.Creator: claurer

English.Text: Reach the next corporation level to implement supporting measures
"The next stages of the Lunar Licensing Program require a well-running interorbital logistics system."

Extensive measures to repair Earth’s biosphere and unrestrained technological growth have brought the world to the brink of an energy crisis. The ultimate goal of the Lunar Licensing Program is to fend off this scenario by putting a fusion energy reactor into operation. But scientist also see other possible applications of fusion energy. As propellant for rocket drives it might one day enable mankind to travel even greater distances in space – if the fusion reactors work as well as everyone hoped. It will be seen, once their construction is completed.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] lauds you for your continuing opposition to the Orbital Watch.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] tells you you can now transport goods to and from Moon.

Striking at the weak spots of their opponents, the Orbital Watch tries to sabotage the Lunar Licencing Program. So far, their terroristic assaults have not brought the program to a standstill. But the newly-founded lunar colonies, as dependent on Earth as they are, are easy targets. And before even the slightest efforts in fusion reactor construction can be dared, the Second Wave colonists must be enabled to provide for themselves.
"Dependence on deliveries from Earth makes it easy for Drake. Make your colony more autarkic."
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] wants you increase the self-sufficiency of your colony.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is satisfied with what measures you have taken.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is glad, you are offering your colonists medication against cosmic radiation.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] notes you have found a way to counter the effects of zero gravity.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] finds a poetical expression to hint at the importance of Maintenance Stations.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is obviously relieved you provide your colonist more substantial food.
"Fusion energy is our best hope to meet humanity’s increasing energy demands."

Extensive measures to repair Earth’s biosphere and unrestrained technological growth have brought the world to the brink of an energy crisis. The ultimate goal of the Lunar Licensing Program is to fend off this scenario by putting a fusion energy reactor into operation. But scientist also see other possible applications of fusion energy. As propellant for rocket drives it might one day enable mankind to travel even greater distances in space – if the fusion reactors work as well as everyone hoped.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] deems you more than able to implement a fusion reactor building project.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is excited to see the fusion energy reactor is performing flawlessly.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] knows, that deuterium is one of the core components of fusion energy generation.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is glad to see the deuterium transfers to the Moon have been taken care of.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] tells you that helium-3 is the basic element in fusion energy generation.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] simmers in expectation of the conclusion of the fusion energy project.
"Modern technology allows for the wireless transfer of energy. Sending it down from space, that's a first though."

A technological marvel in its own right, the newly built fusion reactor merges helium-3 and deuterium, generating clean energy. To share its output with the energy-hungry metropolises on Earth, the Global Union banks on electromagnetical transmission technology, which is already used widely on Earth. However, constructing an energy transmitters able to send microwaves over vast distances will be a challenge – the last and greatest challenge of the Lunar Licensing Program.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] incites you to conclude the Lunar Licensing Program by building energy transmitters.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] brings Virgil Drake's secret Earth base to your attention.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] threatens you as you still pursue the Lunar Licensing Program.
"Weapon research? If Drake thinks he can do this right under the Global Union's nose, he is mistaken!"

The energy crisis is averted! For a few precious days the excitement of Earth’s and Luna’s citizens knew no limits. Robot parades and zero-gravity celebrations were held, the festival halls illuminated with holographic light shows powered by fusion energy. The Lunar Licensing Program might not have ended all of humanity’s problems, let alone the threat by the Orbital Watch, but it brightened the prospects for the future. Your cooperation made all this possible – it is only fitting, that you create a monument for yourself.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] asks you to get her access to the Orbital Watch research servers.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] praises you for your great victory against Drake.
Achieve victory in the crisis sector "[GUIDNAME 5100393]"
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] is impressed with your stealth abilities.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] has gained access to the Orbital Watch servers, already wrecking havoc.

Standard.Name: Reach the Next Corporation Level (Objective Text)
Standard.Creator: claurer

English.Text: Reach the next corporation level to tap the Orbital Watch's secret servers
"All that remains to do is bring the energy transmitters online. I'm counting on you."

The Lunar Licensing Program is nearing its conclusion. What once has been nothing but a distant dream of the future is about to become reality. Humanity’s greatest hopes are pinned on fusion energy as the engine driving a better tomorrow. The final test runs of the energy transmitters will show, if these hopes can ultimately be fulfilled.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] wants you to transfer fusion energy from the Moon down to Earth.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] sounds an eulogy on your achievements.
"A powerful corporation like yours needs an adequate headquarter. I'm sure you agree."

The energy crisis is averted! For a few precious days the excitement of Earth’s and Luna’s citizens knew no limits. Robot parades and zero-gravity celebrations were held, the festival halls illuminated with holographic light shows powered by fusion energy. The Lunar Licensing Program might not have ended all of humanity’s problems, let alone the threat by the Orbital Watch, but it brightened the prospects for the future. And your cooperation made all this possible.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] tells you that you were granted permission to build a prestigeous corporate headquarter.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] hasn't the slightest doubt you are on eye level with the Big Five.
"Feel free to expand your headquarter if you like. You have the Union's approval."

The Big Five are history. Once they were the unassailable potentates of the global economy. But a new star has risen, exclusive business partner of the Global Union and prizewinner of the race to the Moon. Your corporation’s headquarter alone outshines the former Big Five’s offices. And it is only a matter of time, until you will be called to put other projects into practice – projects, that will push humanity forward again, in this new age of space travel.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] believes you will expand your headquarter further, given the chance.
[NOTIFICATION_CHARACTER_NAME] considers herself fortunate having worked with you.
Build any Corporation HQ module
Your long-term goal is to gain and sustain as many employees as possible. Get employees by constructing residences.
Employees are your main source of revenue. They also provide you with workforce to operate your factories.
Keep constructing residences and increase your employee count to unlock new building blueprints and level up your corporation.
Your employees demand a steady supply of goods to generate workforce. Provide these by building factories from the construction menu.
Some factories like mines or farms generate goods out of natural resources from their environment.
More sophisticated goods are often made from several different materials deriving from longer production chains.
Operating factories takes a toll on your revenue. They also require a supply of workforce, energy and logistics to stay productive.
You gain those by constructing power plants and transportation centers, which have their own maintenance costs.
Balancing the earnings and expenses of your ever-growing economy is the main challenge of "Anno 2205."
Your corporation owns a small contingent of military ships. In a crisis, you take control of this fleet.
Reflecting your economic power, you expand your fleet by more ships and ship types as your corporation level rises.
Crisis sectors are self-contained war zones you can leave and return to at any time, as long as no other sector was loaded.
Completing a crisis sector increases your military level, which allows you to upgrade your ships.
You also gain rare materials in crisis sectors, which are needed to upgrade your spaceport and expand your factories with modules.
Any ships lost during a crisis will be replaced afterwards without incurring additional costs.
Through the Lunar Licensing Program, you receive the first sector of every region for free.
You appropriate additional sectors by buying them off a rival Big Five corporation after you surpassed their corporation level.
Look out for unique sector projects. By completing these, you gain access to permanent benefits.
Claim more construction areas in your sectors by establishing warehouses with your command ship.
Each warehouse generates a small amount of revenue, workforce and energy.
In temperate sectors, expand your already claimed areas by connecting islands via bridges.
Your production facilities give off warmth to heat your settlement. Put your residences near factories.
Arctic settlements tend to be naturally smaller than those in the temperate region and cluster around factories.
You can speed up the settlement construction by buying construction materials from traders.
Modules increase productivity and reduce maintenance costs of your factories, while making them more space-efficient. They require rare materials to be built.
Acquire rare materials by completing assignments or achieve victory on missions in crisis sectors.
You are also awarded rare materials as you reach a new corporation level.
You can take a pacifist approach of opposing Orbital Watch by improving your economy and gathering more employees.
Optimize your economic balance with small industrial modules that reduce maintenance costs.
The Council on the space station can be a source of rare materials and especially effective modules.
Clients offering assignments can be found at the trading center in every sector.
Traders sometimes offer a small amount of rare materials – for a not-so-small price.
Check your building layouts for optimal efficiency and use modules to fill empty spots.
As your settlements grow, so will the demands of your employees. Some can only be met by goods from other regions.
While playing, you will create many transfer routes on the strategy map, slowly weaving a global logistics network.
A sectors' spaceport level determines which kinds of transfer routes can go in and out. You need a launch pad for Moon routes.
You can use the goods filter on the strategy map to view the exact production balance of a good in your sectors.
Maintaining transfer routes reduces your credit balance depending on the transporter size. Watch your revenue.
Increase your corporation level to get access to larger and potentially more cost-efficient transporters.
Create a transfer route to the space station to sell your overproduction on the world market. You can also buy goods there at the current value.
Market values of goods are influenced by all "Anno 2205" players who trade on the world market.
Sell goods whose selling price is much higher than their production price. Spot such goods by using the goods filter on the strategy map.
Avoid rampant overproduction. Positive good balances are nice to look at, but they can ruin your credit balance.
Only a certain percentage of employees of every level can be promoted. To have Executives, you need a stable foundation of Workers and Operators.
Build up a vast amount of residences in order to promote more people to the top.
Completing assignments for other corporations is a peaceful way to acquire lots of rare materials.
You gain Graphene in temperate crisis sectors and Petrochemicals in the Arctic.
Demolishing already built modules will refund all rare materials used in their construction.
Even sectors dedicated entirely to production require local employees to provide the workforce.
Assignments and corporation levels always take the total number of employees across all sectors into account.
Your command ship is equipped with an universal drone control unit that allows it to operate all assigned drone types.
Download the "Anno 2205 – Asteroid Miner" app for your mobile device and connect it to your account.
Use the app to mine for rare materials in the asteroid belt and send them over to be used by your corporation.
You can also gain rare materials as an Ubisoft Club Reward ([GUIDNAME 999021] - [GUIDNAME 999005]), and collect them at the space station.
With factories that require mountain or coastal building sites, it's usually cheaper to upgrade them than to spread them out too far. Especially on the Moon.
The lunar warehouse provides an initial shielded area to build in. Shield generators can be placed everywhere, but have maintenance costs.
Moon colonies take some time to become profitable. Attempt lunar colonization not until your coffers are well-filled.
Transportation centers and public buildings are expensive. Place them close to factories and residences to use them efficiently.
Supply buildings add to a collective balance only applying to one island. All other buildings on this island satisfy their demands from that balance.
The greater the distance of a building to a source of logistics or public services, the more supply is consumed by it.
You can store only a limited number of special actions in crisis sectors. Use them regularly.
Move your ships tactically to get damaged ships out of the line of fire or lure enemies into minefields.
Caution is a viable tactic. Try to remain out of reach of enemy turrets.
Crisis sectors offer three difficulty levels, with the harder ones rewarding far more rare materials.
Increasing your military level by achieving victory in crisis sectors grants you access to higher difficulties for all such sectors.
All rare materials can be acquired in all crisis sectors, but the materials rewarded for completing a mission there depend on the region.
You can supply your sectors with goods bought on the world market, if you can afford it.
You can only set up a limited number of transfer routes to the space station, used for buying and selling alike.
Level up your corporation to get access to larger and more cost-efficient transporters and increase the maximum number of space station routes.
To get goods from the Arctic to the Moon you have to upgrade your Arctic spaceport with a launch pad.
Alternatively, you can reroute the goods via a launch pad in the temperate region.
You could also send goods to the Moon directly from the world market. Just be wary of other players driving up the prices.
The corporations electable in The Council reduce construction costs and trade prices for certain industries, depending on their relative votes.
A quick way to gain rare materials is to accept the Mysterious Woman's bribe for your vote in the Council.
Her bribe will increase whenever you vote for someone she didn't recommend. How long can you resist her offers?
The gaps between corporation levels increase with every step. There is no limit to how high you can rise.
Think carefully about where to place your buildings and how to use special building sites. There is only so much construction area.
Make good use of modules, since they affect the product output and maintenance costs of your factories tremendously.
You can pause the production in factories if you want to reduce the maintenance costs for a while.
A spaceport equipped with an energy transmitter is required in every sector you want to transfer energy to.
Energy is shared across connected sectors, with a deficit affecting all sectors equally.
The corporation headquarter has very high maintenance cost. Show everyone that you can afford it.
Beautify your cities with ornaments like fountains or parks of all sizes.
Unlock additional ornaments in the Ubisoft Club. You can also get wallpapers, logos or a new HQ skin there.
Try to complete all sector projects to gain permanent benefits and achievements.
As a long-term goal, aim for one million employees. You will need many sectors and transfer routes to reach that goal.
Play again on a higher difficulty. Or adjust the game to your liking with the advanced settings.
To get access to the advanced AI technology needed for the Mars mission, finish the Sector Project of the "Greentide Archipelago".
Settle more Arctic sectors and focus on building up more population there to achieve the necessary population goal.
The five required technologies are the Tier 4 or 5 researches of each branch. Use your few available workshop modules wisely to unlock them.
Settle more Synths on Mars to unlock more Orbital workshops which allow you to activate more advanced technologies in the Nexus.
Martian Research Complexes and their modules can generate a lot of additional Expertise, now needed to activate high end technologies.
The Mars is rich in mineral ressources, feel free to exploit them!
Hints
